website_summaries.verdict: Offered in an array of gorgeous colors, this skillet is another quality option from the Le Creuset brand.
pros: This skillet is a great choice for frying foods
The high-quality design is durable and easy to clean by hand but can also be put in the dishwasher
Foods won't stick like they do with other pans thanks to the enamel coating
cons: Heavy and the handle gets pretty hot

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality! After one time use...
customer_reviews.text: After only one time of cooking on low heat, my food stuck to the pan and cant seem to clean it. I mean, I use skillets all the time and I expect more from such expensive skillet :(
customer_reviews.author: Soroush

customer_reviews.title: Perfection!
customer_reviews.text: This skillet is the best skillet I have ever owned. I swear the food tastes better in a Le Creuset vessel. I also have the smaller one and my eggs have never tasted better. This is a Christmas gift to me from me and wow, what a gift. I have bought other iron cast items before but Le Creuset is the best ever. I know it's expensive but it is worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: Mariette

customer_reviews.title: Cheap packaging, damaged product and harmful glue inside the pan.
customer_reviews.text: When buying a high-end expensive brand like LE CREUSET, one should expect to receive a perfect product. We received a scratched and dirty pan, that clearly spent time in a warehouse poorly protected. You need to protect your products MUCH BETTER! Also why do you need to put industrial glue inside the pan, just to hold a piece of paper? We buy expensive products because we want to avoid low quality, harmful crap. Adding this chemical junk inside the pan is plain stupid. As a reminder we are going to heat the pan up and cook food inside!! I'm having a hard time getting rid of the glue deposit. Really stupid and disappointing Le Creuset!!
customer_reviews.author: Nicolas

customer_reviews.title: Not great for baking like a lodge cast iron pan.
customer_reviews.text: While this pan looks nice and works well, there's a couple of differences compared to lodge that I dislike. First, the edge of the pan is angled more than a standard cast iron pan. This means it's not great for baking things such as corn bread or pies. Also, the heaviness of the metal is not the same as a cast iron pan, it heats faster and holds heat for less time. If you're used to cooking with cast iron, you'll need to learn again to use this pan.
customer_reviews.author: W.B.E.

customer_reviews.title: No value for money !!!!! It is a shame
customer_reviews.text: It is a disgrace to pay so much money for a sticky pan. Hard to clean afterwards. The cheapest brand pan outshines this product
customer_reviews.author: Mr. G

customer_reviews.title: Came damaged
customer_reviews.text: This product came damaged and used. We bought it as a bday gift for someone for tomorrow and did not check the quality of the product until now. The box even came damaged. Very disappointed and embarrassed to gift someone a used item with damaged packaging. But since last minute will just have to give what we bought.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect little skillet
customer_reviews.text: This is a perfect size for one person. I use it almost every morning to cook an egg. It also works well for a grilled sandwich, or any small quantity of meat or vegetables, etc. Expensive, but reliable Le Creuset quality, handsome and easy to clean. I like to put a silicone sleeve on the handle as the pan gets very hot. Because of its small size, it's much easier to use than the larger LeCreuset pans which are so heavy that they can be awkward to use.
customer_reviews.author: beckertee

customer_reviews.title: Love all things Le Creuset!
customer_reviews.text: Love these to cook with! I've perpetually burnt everything I've ever tried to make in the kitchen until I got Le Creuset pots, and now this skillet. The heat is well dispersed which takes a little to get used to (not everything needs to be cooked on "high" anymore or as long) and the clean up is effortless. Only thing I'll cook with anymore. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: PolarBaker

customer_reviews.title: Is There Any Doubt
customer_reviews.text: I feel a little foolish writing about this. The name says it all. If you can afford it, Le Creuset is always the way to go. I can only afford to buy a piece every once in a while but eventually I'll have all Le Creuset pots and pans. I do have another piece at my place in Florida. The only problem with buying a piece at a time is that you can't always get the same color. So, now I have 3 Le Creusets pieces but all three are different colors, doh !!
customer_reviews.author: gettix

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Pan
customer_reviews.text: Aside from being a beautiful pan, this is the most versatile and easy to clean pan I've owned. Yes, it is pricey and yes, it takes a minute to heat it up. But follow the use and care instructions and I'm sure you will love it as much as I do. One caution: this sucker is heavy, don't buy it if that's a concern for you.
customer_reviews.author: Travel4life

customer_reviews.title: Wish I had bought it sooner...
customer_reviews.text: I didn’t realize how badly I needed this pan until I got it; I only regret that I didn’t purchase the larger size! I have all but abandoned my stainless steel pans in favor of this, which cooks far more evenly. Also, it sears meat beautifully, and cleaning is effortless. The one drawback is its weight, as is the case with all Le Creuset cookware, but needing my husband to help me when pouring out of the pan is well worth the joy it is to cook with!
customer_reviews.author: Jky

customer_reviews.title: Love This Brand
customer_reviews.text: I got this skillet for my son in-law for Christmas and he loves it. When he raves about it so much, I decided to buy myself the equivalent Dutch oven, both items in orange. I’ve never owned Le Creuset until these and love how they cook as well as the easy cleanup! Food just tastes better with these! Very, very expensive but worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Sunflower421

customer_reviews.title: No better than a Lodge
customer_reviews.text: Buy it if you hate money. I’d rather buy a Lodge skillet. This not the stuff of the Dutch ovens that le creuset is famous for. It’s just plain old cast iron interior that you need to season and clean how you would a Wagner or Lodge.
customer_reviews.author: Amzn Customer

customer_reviews.title: Smaller and Shallower
customer_reviews.text: Great quality but cooking surface is smaller (8”) and pan is shallower (1.5”) than I expected. Check dimensions carefully vs what you need it for. 10.5” diameter refers to distance across top of pan and the sides slope outwards quite a bit. I wish the standard for pans would be to report diameter of cooking surface. Still a good buy for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The perfect skillet of its type!
customer_reviews.text: Hands down the best pan ever! A breeze to clean, no matter what you cook in it. I’ve cooked in many many different types of pans over the years and I can say ...comparing it to non sticks and . other cast iron skillets this one is already my favorite. It’s beautiful ... distributes heat wonderfully...and clean up takes two seconds. Remember to pre heat the pan before putting your fat in. 😁
customer_reviews.author: phillip o samuels

customer_reviews.title: So far it's awesome
customer_reviews.text: Made a ton of food on this thing since my all-clad bite the big one. I am stoked to have this thing. It's a really good weight and works super well on my induction top. I look forward to many amazing meals on this guy!
customer_reviews.author: DesertScottAZ

customer_reviews.title: Best pans ever and gorgeous, too
customer_reviews.text: I was beginning doubt a pan could truly be easy to clean. These pans actually are. They are pricey. However, if you are like me and have wasted money on supposedly non-stick pans like Calphalon's (that work well for a month or two) you will celebrate the fact that you finally found non-stick pans that will last a lifetime. I haven't tried abusing them with metal utensils and dont plan to since they cost so much. With care they will go to your grandchildren.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Miera

customer_reviews.title: Unbelievable quality
customer_reviews.text: But they sure make you pay for it! It may be really expensive, but this will last for generations.
customer_reviews.author: MATTHEW T MILLER

customer_reviews.title: Nice, but not what I expected
customer_reviews.text: I do like the pan, but it's not as non stick as I'd like. My regular, old school cast iron pan is far more non stick. It's also smaller than I anticipated. I thought the cooking surface would be larger.
customer_reviews.author: TBarrett

customer_reviews.title: Love it!!!
customer_reviews.text: I received my pan a week ago and absolutely love it! Cooks just like cast iron, with the black enamel you can preheat before adding oil or butter without ruining it, but you don’t have to worry about seasoning the pan or iron leaching into your food. I haven’t had an issue with food sticking and it’s been a breeze to clean. As with cast iron there’s no need cook on higher heat than medium-low as the pan gets really hot. All of my toxic non-stick cookware has been tossed in the garbage!
customer_reviews.author: sophia e thid

customer_reviews.title: So-so?
customer_reviews.text: I have to say, the size and color of this pot are a little under the line of my expectations. But I still gave it five stars. It's as good as ever when you fry a steak. But when you use it to cook other things (not meat product), it just get some difficult to clean. But the pot itself has no quality problems. Just need to be careful not to buy this bad blue one.
customer_reviews.author: Yuhao

customer_reviews.title: Expensive, but worth it!
customer_reviews.text: These pans are expensive, but they literally last forever. They cook evenly, they are solid, heavy, and I am slowly purchasing a whole set of them. Get the silicon cover for the handle, it is worth the extra expense. I love this pan!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Well constructed
customer_reviews.text: I like this pan. Very well constructed. Would have given five stars but it's supposed to be 10-1/2 inches, which it is but not at the bottom, so it's smaller than I thought it would be. I kept because the construction is excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy M.

customer_reviews.title: Pan looks great out of the box Pan is very difficult to ...
customer_reviews.text: Pan looks great out of the box Pan is very difficult to keep clean. I bought white and for a expensive pan it looks terrible. Very disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Bill Moore

customer_reviews.title: Quality control issues
customer_reviews.text: My pan had a ceramic stalagmite on the cooking surface. Due to the hardness of the enamel, I am pretty sure the defect would be present forever. Wound up returning the pan.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Great solid iron base pan.
customer_reviews.text: Great pan and bang for the buck. Big heavy and tough. I have cooked a lot with it right away. Fantastic for flashing steaks.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Troy

customer_reviews.title: Love this Skillet
customer_reviews.text: Arrived with no damage. Will use this skillet tonight when I make Dinner. This skillet will probably last me a life time if I take care of it!
customer_reviews.author: Carlos H. Davila Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Ok pan
customer_reviews.text: Fast delivery. Can’t cook an egg on it. Everything seems to stick. Re-seasoned it and warmed it up slower. Same issue. Think I’ll stick to my old cast iron frying pan
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Lives up to its reputation
customer_reviews.text: I never thought I would spend this much on a frying pan, but I needed a ceramic finish for my glass top oven. This is my first cast iron pan, but it’s been fantastic. Sometimes it’s worth it to spend the extra cash to get a superior product
customer_reviews.author: Hootch M

customer_reviews.title: not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: this is the second purchase of le cruset cookware that has not been worth the money nor the company reputation.. the first item a casserole dish was delivered so warped on the bottom it should never have left the factory. of course it cooks fine, but it rocks when you set it on a flat surface. this skillet was not properly finished on the inside so foods stick and it is difficult to clean
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Enamel cooking surface is not non-stick, and will not clean easily
customer_reviews.text: I have followed all the instructions for the cookware - not cleaning before thoroughly cool, using oils and butter, but it simply burns on food and will not clean. The attached picture is after soaking for 24 hours and it still will not come clean. Will never purchase this cookware again, for the price this is ridiculous.
customer_reviews.author: Stacy J Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Nothing beats Le Creuset!
customer_reviews.text: I have several items from Le Creuset. I like cooking with cast iron. I have a cast iron skillet passed down to me that is at least 80 years old. It's non-stick glaze beats anything. And now I have this new skillet from Creuset. It works beautifully. Cast iron does take extra care, but the performance is well worth it. Le Creuset is the bet of the best.
customer_reviews.author: Ruth Fossett

customer_reviews.title: Tough to clean
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure if this product was defective or not but I could not even cook eggs. I followed all of the instructions and the food would stick to the pan and it was very tough to clean. I returned the pan and had to pay for shipping. I am extremely disappointed with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy Frechette

customer_reviews.title: not the quality I expected for an expensive pan and such good brand
customer_reviews.text: After the third use of this pan, it showed weird spots in the center, as if it is starting to wear off. The pan was washed as instructions recommend. I am disappointed. They sent me a new one, it was worst, now is showing rust parts. I washed with detailed instructions, I just think it is not a good quality.
customer_reviews.author: Luciana

customer_reviews.title: Great non-stick durability
customer_reviews.text: I love the look and durability of the enameled cast iron. The Dutch Baby I made went from stove to oven easily. It didn’t stick to the pan when turned out onto a plate. I wiped it out and seasoned with a little oil in the warm pan and let it cool.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca L

customer_reviews.title: I love the fact that this skillet is cast-iron
customer_reviews.text: I love the fact that this skillet is cast-iron, and will not rust. And of course, it makes it extremely heavy. I cannot fry eggs in it, because they stick to the bottom.
customer_reviews.author: Linda H

customer_reviews.title: Love these skillets!
customer_reviews.text: These are my go to skillets. Great for just about anything!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pan is very hard to use.
customer_reviews.text: This pan is difficult to use. I could not season the pan. Everything I cook sticks even when I use oil. Also it cooks hotter in the center. Perhaps because I have electric burners. Also, it is very heavy. Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Gloria W. Ennis

customer_reviews.title: Love love this pan!
customer_reviews.text: My son gave me this as a present. Cooks really well especially if appropriately pre-heated. Can’t be called a nonstick pan, but it’s pretty close! Food lifts off easily when washed. I love the way it retains heat and browns things nicely.
customer_reviews.author: JayJay

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Pan
customer_reviews.text: This has replaced my other two skillets. Makes perfect eggs. Low temperature is key.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Grigsby

customer_reviews.title: Terrific skillet
customer_reviews.text: We've been using this for a month now. It is not too heavy and the cooking surface is holding up well and does not stick. We have been heating it carefully on a moderate flame and not burning food in it. It washes easily and does not need damaging scrubbing.
customer_reviews.author: bhubbard

customer_reviews.title: It's okay
customer_reviews.text: Not the best Le Creuset cooking product we have ever owned. It also came scratched, but seems to cook fine.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Very nice item
customer_reviews.text: This is very attractive but mainly it browns better than lighter pans on my induction stove.
customer_reviews.author: Ken G.

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I was expecting this to last past the first time I used it. It was horrible, I question if it is authentic. I used it to sear Filets and it just burned them. The pot has patches of areas that are dull. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Christina Lopez

customer_reviews.title: Easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: Great product so far but have only used it a handful of times. Easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Aimee

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Love this brand and this is my second favorite pan.
customer_reviews.author: Elmoze

customer_reviews.title: Everything sticks
customer_reviews.text: This skillet is so difficult to use that I've all but abandoned it.
customer_reviews.author: MFL

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Love this item and the way it disperses heat evenly.
customer_reviews.author: Katie and butch

customer_reviews.title: Cooks nicely what ever I put into it
customer_reviews.text: Cooks nicely what ever I put into it. Hold the heat well even if I add cold ingredients. Now I'm thinking of the next size up.
customer_reviews.author: An observent customer

customer_reviews.title: I use it nearly everyday
customer_reviews.text: Hold temperature very well and evenly distributed heat too. I use it everyday and it’s worth every penny. I purchased a lid with it, but only needed it a few times. It cleans easily.
customer_reviews.author: Marc of Elderberry

customer_reviews.title: As advertised
customer_reviews.text: I've heard about Le Creuset pans and dutch ovens for years, and I finally pulled the trigger on this pan. It was worth every penny I paid. Works like the best Lodge iron skillet I've owned, but cleans up so easily that I barely use my Lodges anymore. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful Kitchen Art
customer_reviews.text: Wife loves her pan and has been making mostly eggs in it (to me I'd rather use a light pan for eggs but it is her) and other dishes as well. Food comes off well and is the high quality of Le Creuset
customer_reviews.author: Andrew K.

customer_reviews.title: Eggs Stick
customer_reviews.text: I read many of the reviews before making my purchase and bought two pans. 6 1/3 and 10 1/4. The pans cook bacon well but forget about eggs. These pans have made there way to the bottom of my drawer and get used when all the rest are dirty.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie K Ruff

customer_reviews.title: cooking surface inside pan is regular cast iron
customer_reviews.text: since cooking surface is cast iron, this pan is a lot easier to keep clean vs. the enameled interior surfaces on most Le Creuset cookware. It is a really heavy pan that does a great job searing and browning. Not sure I love the pour spouts on either side of the pan, that may or may not turn out to be a valued feature
customer_reviews.author: Davidoff

customer_reviews.title: Easy clean up and cooks fast.
customer_reviews.text: Great pan . I use every night for dinner . I put water on it with soap wash off and put in the dishwasher to reuse for the next day . I bought another one for my son. Best pan ever. I cook from chicken , steak , hamburgers and pork loin tenders .
customer_reviews.author: Rhonda

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a gift and it was the best gift ever. Easy to clean if you follow directions. It’s too pretty to put away!
customer_reviews.author: geohans

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality; Love it.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband - our 6th year anniversary - "iron" so I got this; he absolutely LOVES it.
customer_reviews.author: CMB

customer_reviews.title: Cast iron
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised because of the manufacture of this skillet that the food stuck to it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love this skillet
customer_reviews.text: Love this skillet! I love cooking, and have wanted a Le Creuset skillet for years and after a kitchen remodel my husband surprised me with one! Cooks beautifully and cleans up equally well! #worthit
customer_reviews.author: Caitlin Murphy

customer_reviews.title: The seller is very good.
customer_reviews.text: Fed ex screwed up delivery. The vendor was very friendly and helpful in resolving deliery problem. Pan is great. Portions of the review are a bit premature but, this pan matches expectations for LeCreuset hype. I expect that one of my grand kids will end up with it some day and love using it.
customer_reviews.author: frederick faust

customer_reviews.title: It’s worth the extra bucks for quality
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the blemished one but l have looked all over this skillet I can’t find anything wrong this is my second purchase saved about 40 dollars can’t beat that I’m replacing all my cookware Le Creuset they will out live me.
customer_reviews.author: jimmycatboy

customer_reviews.title: Oh I love this skillet. I have had no issues with it
customer_reviews.text: Oh I love this skillet. I have had no issues with it
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: stubborn stains on the bottom of the skillet
customer_reviews.text: I wash mine religiously after every use but there are brown stains on the bottom of the skillet, please let me know how I can restore the color back because I really don’t want to return it. :(
customer_reviews.author: Angel S.

customer_reviews.title: Eggs worked perfectly first time
customer_reviews.text: Just a little Pam and a medium-heat and I had fried eggs that slipped around the pan like it was made of Teflon. Perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne Marsh

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't stick as much as cast-iron, but I wouldn't recommend for eggs
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't stick as much as cast-iron, but I wouldn't recommend for eggs
customer_reviews.author: DT

customer_reviews.title: Le Chrysler cast iron skillet
customer_reviews.text: Love my Le creased cast iron pan! It’s everything I hoped for
customer_reviews.author: marilyn

customer_reviews.title: Fry pan
customer_reviews.text: Can't go wrong with le Creuset. It was a gift to myself.
customer_reviews.author: LInda Y.

customer_reviews.title: Very heavy easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: Replaced a 40 year old skillet I had from my mother. Very Heavy Sturdy Will never break.
customer_reviews.author: S Ro

customer_reviews.title: Just what I hoped for. Worth it.
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Cooks evenly, goes from stove to oven. Looks good on the table for a casual dinner.
customer_reviews.author: MKM

customer_reviews.title: Awesome pan
customer_reviews.text: Nothing sticks. Super pan for omelets.. Cleans easily. Get the little gripper thing for the handle, it gets very hot.
customer_reviews.author: Peter C. Forcey

customer_reviews.title: Great pan love it.
customer_reviews.text: Great pan cooks wonderful very even heat. Bought the glass cover for it too.
customer_reviews.author: Robbert

customer_reviews.title: Best skillet!
customer_reviews.text: My favorite cast iron skillet! I have it in white and blue and love them both!
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: best gift ever!
customer_reviews.text: this pan is a girt for my son, he loves it and cooked some yummy food for us already.
customer_reviews.author: Emily.Liu.RILEY

customer_reviews.title: Good quality!
customer_reviews.text: Not easy to clean! But really good for cooking steak!
customer_reviews.author: Lucky.cocoa

customer_reviews.title: It's a blue skillet that costs a lot but works well.
customer_reviews.text: We use it everyday. I bought it for my girlfriend for Christmas and it works great. It should too because it's damn expensive for a skillet.
customer_reviews.author: PATRICK T RICHARDSON

customer_reviews.title: cast iron pot
customer_reviews.text: works well but I don't think it is worth the extra price
customer_reviews.author: Dolores  Bevans

customer_reviews.title: I would like to return this item
customer_reviews.text: Everything gets stuck on the pan , I heard about this brand but I’m not impress I would like my money back - thanks
customer_reviews.author: Angie

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful
customer_reviews.text: Love this product! Great quality, and so beautiful! I have three LeCruset pans now and I believe they are worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Shasta Alexander

customer_reviews.title: Its not no stick whatsoever
customer_reviews.text: Everytime I cook everything sticks to it and its extremely difficult to get off, risking scratching the enamel. Waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: micah

customer_reviews.title: the worst non-stick pan I had
customer_reviews.text: Everything sticks to this pan... I tried different settings, but my food sticks badly anyway from the first use.
customer_reviews.author: Anastasia

customer_reviews.title: Best shrimp, scallops & steaks!
customer_reviews.text: Cooks the very best shrimp, scallops & steaks we have made. Even heat and well worth the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Amy S vanderLaan

customer_reviews.title: Surface is not very nonstick.
customer_reviews.text: I am a fan of Le Creuset and own many pieces but not happy with the “non-stick” surface on this pan.
customer_reviews.author: T Tuccelli

customer_reviews.title: Love this!
customer_reviews.text: I'd heard about this brand but never tried it. I recently bought a Lodge iron skillet and was definitely disappointed in it. So I decided to give this brand a try. Yes, it is expensive, but it's worth every penny. I use it every chance I get. It goes from stove to oven without a problem, the color is beautiful and it's nonstick. Based on my experience I'm definitely going to buy more pieces.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa

customer_reviews.title: Nice!
customer_reviews.text: The color is beautiful and the interior enamel coating makes using it a breeze during clean up.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Shallcross

customer_reviews.title: Love that Le Creuset
customer_reviews.text: Cooks well and is easy to clean. Love the enamel surface.
customer_reviews.author: SRolls

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works great right out of the box, no sticking issues at all
customer_reviews.author: ThreepE0

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product and color.
customer_reviews.text: Product was boxed carefully with care instructions and a cookbook.
customer_reviews.author: Gloria Howell

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Expensive but great to work with I am glad I bought this pan.
customer_reviews.author: Marcus

customer_reviews.title: Problem with Le Creuset  skillet
customer_reviews.text: The inside of the pan contrary to being all black which it should be has light grey for approximately one third of the pan,which leads me to believe that that the pan is defective. Aside from that it works as a pan should.
customer_reviews.author: David Mindich

customer_reviews.title: every kitchen should have one of these beautiful handy do-it-all skillets
customer_reviews.text: every kitchen should have one of these beautiful handy do-it-all skillets. I plan on using it for a long time
customer_reviews.author: Suzie H

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Was as pretty as I thought it would be. Cooks very well
customer_reviews.author: DB

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my husband who is the family chef. He uses it EVERY day
customer_reviews.author: Lisa M. B.

customer_reviews.title: I love it and can't wait to order it in the ...
customer_reviews.text: My go to pan... I love it and can't wait to order it in the larger size. It is perfect for pan frying meats, sautéing vegetables and making French toast.
customer_reviews.author: Justine M. Hintz

customer_reviews.title: Love!
customer_reviews.text: Love this frying pan. Still getting used to the pan and which temperature works best.
customer_reviews.author: MelG

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I love Le creuset pans, and the new black interior: GREAT!
customer_reviews.author: MORRISBLUE

customer_reviews.title: Just perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Love it! Made my scrambled eggs in it this morning. They were just perfect! Definitely get a silicone sleeve for the handle! The pan is on the heavy side, but not so heavy I can't lift it/move it around with one hand. I also like that the handle is a little shorter, so it doesn't get in the way. The bottom is smooth, so I'm not worried about it scratching my glass cooktop. The size of the pan (10.25") is just perfect for my large burner, which is 9" across.
customer_reviews.author: Donna K.

customer_reviews.title: It is a beautiful color and the quality is up to the high ...
customer_reviews.text: It is a beautiful color and the quality is up to the high Le Creuset standard. Really enjoy using it.
customer_reviews.author: mjc

customer_reviews.title: Good, sturdy skillet
customer_reviews.text: Good, sturdy skillet. The only problem is that it is not a non stick pan. You have to really coat it with a little oil before cooking anything or else your food will stick to the pot. Stuck on food is difficult to remove. I had to soak in warm soapy water and then do a little scrubbing. Otherwise it is a good skillet. Once heated, it cooks nicely, and you don't have to turn up the fire too high.
customer_reviews.author: K. Mcfarlane

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Not as easy to clean as I hoped for cast iron, but a vast improvement over my Lodge!
customer_reviews.author: HisKitten19

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Great skillet,exactly what I was expected from Le Creuset. But cheaper than in Williams-Sonoma Unfortunately doesn`t come with a lid.
customer_reviews.author: alinla

product_meta.title: Le Creuset LS2024-2659 Signature Iron Handle Skillet, 10-1/4-Inch, Marseille
product_meta.description: Color:Marseille| Size:10-1/4-Inch| Design:PanInspired by nearly a century of culinary craftsmanship, Le Creuset is proud to present the Signature collection as the next evolution of its enameled cast-iron cookware. Signature seamlessly blends Le Creusets classic form and feel with the latest ergonomic and functional innovations.
feature_bullets: Heavyweight fry pan requires very little oil, making it an excellent choice for low-fat cooking
Optimized for steady, even heat, Le Creusets improved enamel interior resists staining, dulling, and wear and tear
Black enamel interior requires no additional seasoning, unlike other cast-iron cookware
New large loop helper handle facilitates lifting the pan and provides a better grip even while wearing oven mitts
Enameled cast-iron construction provides superior heat retention. Dishwasher safe for fast, convenient cleanup
